attributes.title: Stock verification
attributes.description:
Findings;

·       A stock take exercise was conducted on 17.04.25 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets.

·       The stock take findings were as follows,

Ø  Bread-     (-66 loaves)

Ø  Polybags-   (-66 pcs)

Ø  Crates-      (-1 )

Summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: ·        Management should improve controls on bread movement.
attributes.effect: No material variance was noted indicating that stock controls are effective.

value: We will improve on bread controls
Crate lost will be recovered and overall controls will be improved.
In the previous audit findings bread had a shortfall of 41 loaves and polybags had a variance of +294 pcs.

attributes.title: Bread weight check
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

·        Both sample varieties had few cases of underweight.

·        The underweight samples were spread as follows; 200g W- 11% and 400g W- 01%.

The table below summarizes the findings
attributes.recommendation: Weight controls should be strengthened to eradicate cases of underweight in all bread varieties.
attributes.effect: The presence of underweight bread expose the company to non-compliance issues.

value: To be improved
More control measures will be initiated.
In the previous audit findings, underweight were spread as follows; 400g W- 01% and 200g w- 24%.
Previous

attributes.title: Bread damages Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Analysis of bread damages from 01.03.25 – 16.04.25 was done to verify if the level of bread damages was maintained within the acceptable limits of 0.25% of the total production and 0.2% of the total sales.

·        A total of 1,576 loaves were damaged under production damages which represent 0.35% of the total loaves produced.

·        1,089.5 loaves were damaged under market damages representing 0.22% of the total sales over the audited period.

·        The total damages exceeded the set limits by 530 loaves worth Ksh. 28,355

Below is a summary table of the findings
attributes.recommendation: ·        Bread damages should be maintained within the set limits.
attributes.effect: ·        Excess bread damages worth Ksh. 28,355 is an indication that the company is expose to losses due to excess damages.

value: Excess damages was contributed by oven breakdown which took long before it was fully repaired.
This was contributed by oven breakdown and we are working to ensure that both production and market damages are maintained within the set limits.
oth market and production damages were maintained within the set limit as per the previous audit findings.
Previous

attributes.title: Mixing chart analysis
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 01.03.25 – 16.04.25 to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done.

·        There was no material variance between system and the actual material consumption.

·        No significant variance in bread posting noted over the audited period.

Below are the summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: The branch should continue observing the set production standards.

value: ·        We will maintain.
·        We will maintain.
Production standards were observed as per the previous audit findings.
Previous

attributes.title: Cash verification
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        A spot check was done on cash office to verify if the branch cash was well kept and proper records maintained.

·        No material variances were noted on the spot-check day.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should ensure that petty cash records and balances are well maintained.
attributes.effect: ·        The immaterial variance noted in cash office is an indication that   effective controls are in place.

value: To be maintained.
The positive trend will be maintained.
No variances were reported in the cash office in the previous audit findings.

attributes.title: Minishop spot checks
attributes.description:
Finding;

·        Spot checks was done on the branch minishops; Bombolulu, Kongowea and Barsheba to find out if they were run as per the company policy.

·        All the three shop attendants correctly accounted for their stock.
attributes.recommendation: The branch to continue following Minishop management SOPs.
attributes.effect: Minishops are properly managed

value: We will maintain the trend.
Minishop SOPs will always be observed.
No variances were noted in previous audit spot-checks.

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        The branch production efficiency was analyzed from 01.03.25 – 16.04.25 to find out if the branch achieved the set efficiency of 4.5 bags per worker.

·        The branch hired a total of 505 workers over the audited period hence the expected production was 2,273 bags.

·        The actual production was 2,269 bags leading to a production shortfall of 4 bags and the actual efficiency was 4.49 bags per worker which is within the range.

Production efficiency
attributes.recommendation: ·        Management to ensure that proper planning of production workers is always done for consistent target attainment.
attributes.effect: The set efficiency was achieved indicating that the planned production labour cost was observed.

value: This is noted and we will further improve.
Further improvement measures will be initiated.
The production efficiency reported in the previous audit findings was 4.48 bags per worker.

attributes.title: Packaging Efficiency
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Production and packaging efficiency were analyzed from 01.03.25 – 16.04.25 to find out if the branch achieved the set efficiency of 97 crates per worker.

·        The total bread produced over the audited period is 34,259 crates hence the expected slicers to be hired was 353 workers.

·        A total of 335 workers were hired and the actual efficiency was 102.3 crates per worker.

·        The set efficiency was achieved.

Packaging efficiency
attributes.recommendation: Proper planning of packaging workers should be maintained
attributes.effect: The set packaging efficiency was achieved indicating that the set packing labour cost was observed.

value: To be maintained
To be maintained
Packaging efficiency was not achieved in the previous audit findings

attributes.title: Generator Fuel Analysis
attributes.description:
·        Review of generator fuel usage and machine hours records was done to ascertain that its use is as per the set policies.

·        Standard fuel consumption for the branch generator was 18.35 L

·        The generator had run for 14.7 hours and used 151 litres of fuel over the period from 1 March to 3 March 2025.

·        The average rate of fuel consumption was 10.3 L/Hr.

Summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: Proper controls should be maintained.
attributes.effect: Fuel usage is within the limit indicating that proper generator controls are in place.

value: To be maintained.
To be maintained.
The average fuel consumption rate reported in the previous audit findings was 20.7 L/Hr.
